      • isRenameChange

        public static boolean isRenameChange(Change change)
        Parameters:
        change - "Change" description.
        Returns:
        Return true if the "Change" object is created for "Rename" operation: in this case name of files for "before" and "after" revisions must not coincide.

      • isChangeForNew

        public static boolean isChangeForNew(Change change)
        Parameters:
        change - "Change" description.
        Returns:
        Return true if the "Change" object is created for "New" operation: "before" revision is obviously NULL, while "after" revision is not.

      • isChangeForDeleted

        public static boolean isChangeForDeleted(Change change)
        Parameters:
        change - "Change" description.
        Returns:
        Return true if the "Change" object is created for "Delete" operation: "before" revision is NOT NULL, while "after" revision is NULL.

      • isChangeForFolder

        public static boolean isChangeForFolder(Change change)

      • sortPathsFromOutermost

        public static FilePath[] sortPathsFromOutermost(FilePath[] files)
        Sort file paths so that paths under the same root are placed from the outermost to the innermost (farthest from the root).
        Parameters:
        files - An array of file paths to be sorted. Sorting is done over the parameter.
        Returns:
        Sorted array of the file paths.

      • getOneVirtualFile

        public static VirtualFile getOneVirtualFile(AnActionEvent e)
        Parameters:
        e - ActionEvent object
        Returns:
        VirtualFile available in the current context. Returns not null if and only if exactly one file is available.

      • getVirtualFiles

        public static VirtualFile [] getVirtualFiles(AnActionEvent e)
        Parameters:
        e - ActionEvent object
        Returns:
        VirtualFiles available in the current context. Returns empty array if there are no available files.

      • chopTrailingChars

        public static java.lang.String chopTrailingChars(java.lang.String source,
                                                 char[] chars)
        Parameters:
        source - Source string
        chars - Symbols to be trimmed
        Returns:
        string without all specified chars at the end. For example, chopTrailingChars("c:\\my_directory\\//\\",new char[]{'\\'}) is "c:\\my_directory\\//", chopTrailingChars("c:\\my_directory\\//\\",new char[]{'\\','/'}) is "c:\my_directory". Actually this method can be used to normalize file names to chop trailing separator chars.
